LayoutNode.Content: Alex is married to Jennifer Widom. Jennifer and Alex have a son Tim and a daughter Emily. Here are some photos from the family's travels.
LayoutNode.SRC: Alex is married to Jennifer Widom. Jennifer and Alex have a son Tim and a daughter Emily. Here are some photos from the family's travels.

LayoutNode.Content: Legion is a data-centric parallel programming system for hierarchical, heterogeneous, distributed parallel machines. Legion focuses on providing mechanisms for the placement and movement of data, allowing programmers to express locality and independence of data while also automating many of the tedious tasks programmers currently face in programming large-scale supercomputers.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Legion is a data-centric parallel programming system for hierarchical, heterogeneous, distributed parallel machines. Legion focuses on providing mechanisms for the placement and movement of data, allowing programmers to express locality and independence of data while also automating many of the tedious tasks programmers currently face in programming large-scale supercomputers.

LayoutNode.Content: Terra, a statically typed low-level language that is integrated with and meta-programmed by Lua (a dynamically typed high-level language) is now available. Terra provides support for producing very high performance code using meta-programming techniques.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Terra, a statically typed low-level language that is integrated with and meta-programmed by Lua (a dynamically typed high-level language) is now available. Terra provides support for producing very high performance code using meta-programming techniques.

LayoutNode.Content: Mistral, a SMT solver incorporating support for abductive inference and fast solutions of integer linear constraints, is now publicly released.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Mistral, a SMT solver incorporating support for abductive inference and fast solutions of integer linear constraints, is now publicly released.

LayoutNode.Content: CS357: Techniques for Program Analysis and Verification
LayoutNode.SRC: CS357: Techniques for Program Analysis and Verification

LayoutNode.Content: My publicly available, free, self-study compilers course. The course covers the essentials of compiler construction, plus material on language design and semantics, optimization, and bit on the history of programming languages. There are optional programming assignments for hard-core enthusiasts who want to build a full, functioning compiler for COOL, the Classroom Object Oriented Language.
LayoutNode.SRC: • My publicly available, free, self-study compilers course. The course covers the essentials of compiler construction, plus material on language design and semantics, optimization, and bit on the history of programming languages. There are optional programming assignments for hard-core enthusiasts who want to build a full, functioning compiler for COOL, the Classroom Object Oriented Language.

LayoutNode.SRC: A Type System for Safe and Scalable Parallelism using Logical Regions (Extended Version)

LayoutNode.Content: Legion is a programming system for heterogenous, parallel machines with complex memory hierarchies. There is no web page yet, but there is a paper that will appear in SuperComputing '12 and another draft of a paper on the type system (complete with a long, tedious soundness proof).
LayoutNode.SRC: • Legion is a programming system for heterogenous, parallel machines with complex memory hierarchies. There is no web page yet, but there is a paper that will appear in SuperComputing '12 and another draft of a paper on the type system (complete with a long, tedious soundness proof).

LayoutNode.Content: DeduceIt is a system for checking student derivations in on-line courses; the idea is to provide a richer and more interactive electronic homework than multiple choice questions for problems that can be formulated as derivations in some formal system. A number of things are available:
LayoutNode.SRC: DeduceIt is a system for checking student derivations in on-line courses; the idea is to provide a richer and more interactive electronic homework than multiple choice questions for problems that can be formulated as derivations in some formal system. A number of things are available:

LayoutNode.Content: A demo video if you just want to get an idea of how it works.
LayoutNode.SRC: • A demo video if you just want to get an idea of how it works.

LayoutNode.Content: The live DeduceIt system, where you can try a number of different kinds of exercises developed for the undergraduate compiler course I teach.
